title: Hugh Byrne (rugby league)
text:
Hugh "Jazzer" Byrne (1904–1983) was an Australian <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1920s and 1930s.
Born on 28 April 1904 at <a href="Woollahra%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Woollahra, New South Wales</a>, Byrne became a large, striding <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions">winger</a>. Byrne played for <a href="Sydney%20Roosters">Eastern Suburbs</a> (1925–1928 and 1930) and <a href="South%20Sydney%20Rabbitohs">South Sydney</a> (1932–33).
In 1928 Byrne was selected to represent Australia in a test match against England. 
Byrne died on 22 December 1983, aged 79.
